flawed_nl_solution:
On the eastern part of the campsite, Mr Manuel counted 2*100 = <<2*100=2000>>2000 tents
The total number of tents in the eastern and the northern part of the campgrounds is 2000+100 = <<2000+100=2100>>2100
There are four times as many tents as the northernmost part in the central part of the campsite, which means there are 4*100 = <<4*100=400>>400 tents in the central part of the camp.
The total number of tents in the three parts of the campsite is 400+2100 = <<400+2100=2500>>2500
If you add the number of tents Mr. Manuel counted at the southern part of the campsite, you get 2500+200 = <<2500+200=2700>>2700 tents on the whole campsite
#### 2700

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 2000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
